intro: Tithymalus jaxarticus, commonly known as the Central Asian tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and the Tian Shan mountains. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are characteristic of the carrot family. Tithymalus jaxarticus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
